commands.name: _completion
commands.description: BASH completion hook.
commands.help:
To enable BASH completion, run:

    <comment>eval `[program] _completion -g`</comment>.

Or for an alias:

    <comment>eval `[program] _completion -g -p [alias]`</comment>.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Displays help for a command
commands.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud help list</info>

You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud help --format=xml list</info>

To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

commands.name: legacy-migrate
commands.description: Migrate from the legacy file structure
commands.help:
Before version 3.x, the Magento Cloud CLI required a project to have a "repository"
directory containing the Git repository, "builds", "shared" and others. From
version 3, the Git repository itself is treated as the project. Metadata is
stored inside the repository (in .magento/local) and ignored by Git.

This command will migrate from the old file structure to the new one.

no-backup.description: Do not create a backup of the project.

no.description: Answer "no" to any yes/no questions; disable interaction

commands.name: list
commands.description: Lists commands
commands.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud list</info>

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud list test</info>

You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud list --format=xml</info>

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

  <info>php /apps/jenkins/latest/.magento-cloud/bin/magento-cloud list --raw</info>

commands.name: auth:api-token-login
commands.description: Log in to Magento Cloud using an API token
commands.help:
Use this command to log in to your Magento Cloud account using an API token.

You can create an account at:
    <info>https://accounts.magento.cloud</info>

If you have an account, but you do not already have an API token, you can create one here:
    <info>https://accounts.magento.cloud/user/api-tokens</info>

Alternatively, to log in to the CLI with a browser, run:
    <info>magento-cloud auth:browser-login</info>

yes.name: --yes
yes.description: Answer "yes" to any yes/no questions; disable interaction

no.name: --no
no.description: Answer "no" to any yes/no questions; disable interaction

commands.name: auth:browser-login
commands.description: Log in to Magento Cloud via a browser
commands.help:
Use this command to log in to the Magento Cloud CLI using a web browser.

It launches a temporary local website which redirects you to log in if
necessary, and then captures the resulting authorization code.

Your system's default browser will be used. You can override this using the
<info>--browser</info> option.

Alternatively, to log in using an API token (without a browser), run:
<info>magento-cloud auth:api-token-login</info>

To authenticate non-interactively, configure an API token using the
<info>MAGENTO_CLOUD_CLI_TOKEN</info> environment variable.

force.description: Log in again, even if already logged in

commands.name: environment:synchronize
commands.description: Synchronize an environment's code and/or data from its parent
commands.help:
This command synchronizes to a child environment from its parent environment.

Synchronizing "code" means there will be a Git merge from the parent to the
child. Synchronizing "data" means that all files in all services (including
static files, databases, logs, search indices, etc.) will be copied from the
parent to the child.

commands.name: integration:validate
commands.description: Validate an existing integration
commands.help:
This command allows you to check whether an integration is valid.

An exit code of 0 means the integration is valid, while 4 means it is invalid.
Any other exit code indicates an unexpected error.

Integrations are validated automatically on creation and on update. However,
because they involve external resources, it is possible for a valid integration
to become invalid. For example, an access token may be revoked, or an external
repository may be deleted.

Use this command to check the disk size and usage for an application's mounts.

commands.name: tunnel:open
usage: magento-cloud tunnel:open [-p|--project PROJECT] [--host HOST] [-e|--environment ENVIRONMENT] [-A|--app APP] [-i|--identity-file IDENTITY-FILE]
commands.description: Open SSH tunnels to an app's relationships
commands.help:
This command opens SSH tunnels to all of the relationships of an application.

Connections can then be made to the application's services as if they were
local, for example a local MySQL client can be used, or the Solr web
administration endpoint can be accessed through a local browser.

This command requires the posix and pcntl PHP extensions (as multiple
background CLI processes are created to keep the SSH tunnels open). The
<info>tunnel:single</info> command can be used on systems without these
extensions.
